intro: Phelipanche nana, commonly known as the dwarf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pale blue or purple in color. Its roots are tuberous and can persist in the soil for several years, allowing it to survive as a weed in cultivated areas. The plant is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, where it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats.
